com.clusterpoint.api.request

Class CPSAlternativesRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.clusterpoint.api.CPSRequest
      • com.clusterpoint.api.request.CPSAlternativesRequest

  • public class CPSAlternativesRequest
extends CPSRequest
    The CPSAlternativesRequest class is a wrapper for the CPSRequest class for the alternatives command
    See Also:
    CPSAlternativesResponse

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class com.clusterpoint.api.CPSRequest

        CPSREQUEST_TYPE_AUTO, CPSREQUEST_TYPE_CLUSTER, CPSREQUEST_TYPE_SINGLE

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void setCr(double value)
      Minimum ratio between the occurrence of the alternative and the occurrence of the search term.
      void setH(double value)
      A number that limits the overall estimate of the quality of the alternative, the greater the cr value and the smaller the idif value, the greater the h value.
      void setIdif(double value)
      A number that limits how much the alternative may differ from the search term, the greater the idif value, the greater the allowed difference.
      void setQuery(java.lang.String value)
      Sets the search query.

    • Method Detail

      • setQuery

        public void setQuery(java.lang.String value)
              throws java.lang.Exception
        Sets the search query. Example usage: r.setQuery(CPSTerm.getString("predefined_term", "/generated_fields/type/"));
        Parameters:
        value - The query string. All <, > and & characters that aren't supposed to be XML tags, should be escaped (e.g. with CPSTerm);
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        See Also:
        CPSTerm

      • setCr

        public void setCr(double value)
           throws java.lang.Exception
        Minimum ratio between the occurrence of the alternative and the occurrence of the search term. If this parameter is increased, less results are returned while performance is improved.
        Parameters:
        value - cr value
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • setIdif

        public void setIdif(double value)
             throws java.lang.Exception
        A number that limits how much the alternative may differ from the search term, the greater the idif value, the greater the allowed difference. If this parameter is increased, more results are returned while performance is decreased.
        Parameters:
        value - idif value
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • setH

        public void setH(double value)
          throws java.lang.Exception
        A number that limits the overall estimate of the quality of the alternative, the greater the cr value and the smaller the idif value, the greater the h value. If this parameter is increased, less results are returned while performance is improved.
        Parameters:
        value - h value
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
